sub_subject.name: Historical & Cultural Context
sub_subject.description: 13-year academic progression (K-12) for Historical & Cultural Context (Bible & Theology)

objectives.objective_text: Identify that the Bible covers a very, very long time.
Identify God as the one who spoke the world into being.
Name the sun and moon as lights God made, not gods to worship.
Identify that the Old Testament was written in Hebrew.
Name 'Shalom' as a Hebrew word for peace.
Identify rules as things that keep us safe.
Name the Ten Commandments as God's special rules.
Identify Egypt as the land of Pyramids and the Nile River.
Name Abraham's first home as the city of Ur.
Identify a Roman road.
Name a boat sailing on the sea.
Identify the lack of pirates on the sea.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Roman Religion and the Imperial Cult
objectives.objective_text: Identify statues of Roman gods.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Roman Religion and the Imperial Cult
objectives.objective_text: Name Caesar as the Emperor.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Roman Religion and the Imperial Cult
objectives.objective_text: Identify Jupiter or Mars.
Identify a master and a servant.
Name a rich person and a poor person.
Identify Onesimus (a runaway slave).

objectives.sub_topic_name: Second Temple Judaism and Key Sects (Pharisees, Sadducees)
objectives.objective_text: Identify the Temple in Jesus' time.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Second Temple Judaism and Key Sects (Pharisees, Sadducees)
objectives.objective_text: Name the Pharisees (strict rules).

objectives.sub_topic_name: Second Temple Judaism and Key Sects (Pharisees, Sadducees)
objectives.objective_text: Identify the Sanhedrin (Jewish court).

objectives.sub_topic_name: The Synagogue System and the Sanhedrin
objectives.objective_text: Identify a Synagogue as a church for Jews.

objectives.sub_topic_name: The Synagogue System and the Sanhedrin
objectives.objective_text: Name the Rabbi (teacher).

objectives.sub_topic_name: The Synagogue System and the Sanhedrin
objectives.objective_text: Identify the seat of Moses.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Feasts, Festivals, and the Jewish Calendar
objectives.objective_text: Identify Passover (special dinner).

objectives.sub_topic_name: Feasts, Festivals, and the Jewish Calendar
objectives.objective_text: Name Hanukkah (lights).

objectives.sub_topic_name: Feasts, Festivals, and the Jewish Calendar
objectives.objective_text: Identify Tabernacles (camping out).
Identify that people were waiting for a King.
Name the Messiah (Rescuer).
Identify the hope of resurrection.
Recall that Jesus came at exactly the right time.
Recall that other people believed scary stories about monsters making the world.
Recall that Jesus spoke a language called Aramaic.
Observe what Hebrew letters look like (reading right to left).
Recall that kings in Bible times made rules on big stones.
Observe that God's laws are fair and good.
Recall that people in Bible times wrote on clay and stone.
Observe pictures of ancient ziggurats (tall towers).
Recall that Paul traveled to tell people about Jesus.
Observe that it was safe to travel then.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Roman Religion and the Imperial Cult
objectives.objective_text: Recall that Romans wanted people to worship the Emperor.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Roman Religion and the Imperial Cult
objectives.objective_text: Observe that Christians said 'Jesus is Lord'.
Recall that Jesus loves everyone the same.
Observe that Romans had strict rules about who was important.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Second Temple Judaism and Key Sects (Pharisees, Sadducees)
objectives.objective_text: Recall that they didn't like Jesus.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Second Temple Judaism and Key Sects (Pharisees, Sadducees)
objectives.objective_text: Observe men reading scrolls.

objectives.sub_topic_name: The Synagogue System and the Sanhedrin
objectives.objective_text: Recall that they read the Bible every Sabbath.

objectives.sub_topic_name: The Synagogue System and the Sanhedrin
objectives.objective_text: Observe Jesus teaching in the synagogue.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Feasts, Festivals, and the Jewish Calendar
objectives.objective_text: Recall that God gave them holidays to remember Him.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Feasts, Festivals, and the Jewish Calendar
objectives.objective_text: Observe a Menorah.
Recall that they wanted him to fight the Romans.
Observe people praying for help.
Order the pictures of Adam, Noah, Moses, and Jesus.
Use a timeline string to see who lived first.
Summarize the main eras: Creation, Patriarchs, Exodus, Kings, Exile.
Explain the difference between BC (Before Christ) and AD (Anno Domini).
Explain the debate between the Early Date and Late Date of the Exodus.
Defend the historicity of the biblical timeline against minimalism.
Produce a study on the significance of the '400 Silent Years'.
Express thanks that our God is good and loving.
Summarize the difference between believing in one God (Monotheism) and many gods (Polytheism).
Explain that Genesis says humans are special rulers, not slaves to gods.
Categorize the stars as creation, not controllers of our fate.
Explain the concept of the 'Cosmic Temple' in ancient thought.
Defend the transcendence and immanence of God against pantheism.
Produce an essay on how the biblical worldview dignifies humanity.
Summarize how we got our English Bible from the original languages.
Explain that some parts of Daniel were written in Aramaic.
Explain why the Jews translated the OT into Greek (the Septuagint).
Defend the preservation of the biblical text through history.
Summarize the idea of 'eye for an eye' (fairness, not revenge).
Explain what a 'treaty' is (an agreement between a king and people).
Explain how the Mosaic law protected servants and women uniquely in the ancient world.
Perform research on the Hittite treaties of the 2nd millennium BC.
Summarize the geography of the Fertile Crescent.
Explain how the Nile River helped Egypt grow food.
Locate Babylon, Assyria, and Egypt on a Bible map.
Explain the significance of the 'cradle of civilization' for biblical history.
Defend the historical reliability of the biblical account amidst ANE records.
Summarize 'Pax Romana' (Roman Peace).
Explain how good roads helped spread the Gospel.
Explain the role of Roman colonies like Philippi.
Defend the providential timing of Christ's birth.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Roman Religion and the Imperial Cult
objectives.objective_text: Summarize Polytheism (many gods).

objectives.sub_topic_name: Roman Religion and the Imperial Cult
objectives.objective_text: Explain why Christians got in trouble (refusing to worship Caesar).

objectives.sub_topic_name: Roman Religion and the Imperial Cult
objectives.objective_text: Explain the 'atheism' charge against Christians (no visible god).

objectives.sub_topic_name: Roman Religion and the Imperial Cult
objectives.objective_text: Defend the exclusivity of the Christian confession.
Summarize the difference between a Citizen and a Non-Citizen.
Explain that many people were slaves in Rome.
Explain the role of women in the Roman world vs. the Church.
Defend the biblical undermining of the institution of slavery.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Second Temple Judaism and Key Sects (Pharisees, Sadducees)
objectives.objective_text: Summarize the difference between Pharisees and Sadducees.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Second Temple Judaism and Key Sects (Pharisees, Sadducees)
objectives.objective_text: Explain what a 'Scribe' did.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Second Temple Judaism and Key Sects (Pharisees, Sadducees)
objectives.objective_text: Explain the Essene community at Qumran (Dead Sea Scrolls).

objectives.sub_topic_name: Second Temple Judaism and Key Sects (Pharisees, Sadducees)
objectives.objective_text: Defend Jesus' interaction with the Law vs. Tradition.

objectives.sub_topic_name: The Synagogue System and the Sanhedrin
objectives.objective_text: Summarize what happened in a Synagogue service (Reading, Prayer).

objectives.sub_topic_name: The Synagogue System and the Sanhedrin
objectives.objective_text: Explain that the Temple was for sacrifice, Synagogue for learning.

objectives.sub_topic_name: The Synagogue System and the Sanhedrin
objectives.objective_text: Explain the significance of 10 men (Minyan).

objectives.sub_topic_name: The Synagogue System and the Sanhedrin
objectives.objective_text: Defend the importance of the Synagogue in preserving the faith.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Feasts, Festivals, and the Jewish Calendar
objectives.objective_text: Summarize the Seder meal.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Feasts, Festivals, and the Jewish Calendar
objectives.objective_text: Explain Pentecost (Harvest feast).

objectives.sub_topic_name: Feasts, Festivals, and the Jewish Calendar
objectives.objective_text: Explain the Day of Atonement (Yom Kippur).

objectives.sub_topic_name: Feasts, Festivals, and the Jewish Calendar
objectives.objective_text: Defend the Typology of the Feasts pointing to Christ.
Summarize why they were surprised by Jesus (He was humble).
Explain 'Son of David'.
Explain the concept of the 'Age to Come'.
Defend Jesus' redefinition of the Messiahship.
Recognize that translation involves choosing the best words.
Identify men thinking and talking in Athens.
Name Paul talking to thinkers on Mars Hill.
Identify the 'Unknown God'.
Compare the time of David (1000 BC) to the time of the Exile (586 BC).
Calculate how many years ago Jesus lived.
Analyze the genealogies in Genesis (understanding 'begat').
Interpret the 480 years mentioned in 1 Kings 6:1.
Connect biblical events to fixed dates in history (e.g., Battle of Carchemish).
Compare the peace of the Garden of Eden with the violence of other creation myths.
Analyze the Enuma Elish and its contrast with Genesis 1.
Interpret Genesis 1 as a 'polemic' (argument) against pagan worldviews.
Connect the biblical view of nature (demythologized) to the rise of science.
Compare the look of English letters to Hebrew letters.
Analyze the importance of the Dead Sea Scrolls.
Connect the Ugaritic language to understanding difficult Hebrew poetry.
Compare the harsh laws of Hammurabi with the laws of Moses.
Apply the idea that God is our King and we are His people.
Analyze the suzerain-vassal treaty structure in Deuteronomy.
Interpret the difference between apodictic (absolute) and casuistic (case) law.
Connect the blessings and curses of the Law to ancient treaty formats.
Compare the life of an Israelite shepherd with an Egyptian city dweller.
Analyze the geopolitical struggle between the empires of the North (Assyria/Babylon) and the South (Egypt).
Interpret the cultural significance of the Code of Hammurabi.
Connect the plagues of Egypt to specific Egyptian false gods.
Compare travel then (walking/sailing) with travel now.
Analyze the extent of the Roman road network.
Interpret the phrase 'in the fullness of time' regarding Roman infrastructure.
Connect the common Greek language (Koine) to ease of communication.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Roman Religion and the Imperial Cult
objectives.objective_text: Compare the true God with idols.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Roman Religion and the Imperial Cult
objectives.objective_text: Analyze the syncretism of the Roman world.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Roman Religion and the Imperial Cult
objectives.objective_text: Interpret the political nature of worshiping Caesar.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Roman Religion and the Imperial Cult
objectives.objective_text: Connect the persecution in Revelation to the Imperial Cult.
Compare the way Rome treated people with how the Church did.
Analyze the Patron-Client system.
Interpret Paul's teaching on 'neither slave nor free'.
Connect social status to the seating at the Lord's Supper.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Second Temple Judaism and Key Sects (Pharisees, Sadducees)
objectives.objective_text: Compare the Zealots (fighters) with the Essenes (monks).

objectives.sub_topic_name: Second Temple Judaism and Key Sects (Pharisees, Sadducees)
objectives.objective_text: Analyze the 'Tradition of the Elders'.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Second Temple Judaism and Key Sects (Pharisees, Sadducees)
objectives.objective_text: Interpret Jesus' critique of legalism.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Second Temple Judaism and Key Sects (Pharisees, Sadducees)
objectives.objective_text: Connect the Sadducees to the Temple power.

objectives.sub_topic_name: The Synagogue System and the Sanhedrin
objectives.objective_text: Compare a Synagogue ruler with a Priest.

objectives.sub_topic_name: The Synagogue System and the Sanhedrin
objectives.objective_text: Analyze the role of the Sanhedrin in the trial of Jesus.

objectives.sub_topic_name: The Synagogue System and the Sanhedrin
objectives.objective_text: Interpret the Diaspora (Jews living outside Israel).

objectives.sub_topic_name: The Synagogue System and the Sanhedrin
objectives.objective_text: Connect the Synagogue to the pattern of early Christian worship.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Feasts, Festivals, and the Jewish Calendar
objectives.objective_text: Compare the Sabbath (rest) with a yearly festival.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Feasts, Festivals, and the Jewish Calendar
objectives.objective_text: Analyze the prophetic meaning of the Feasts.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Feasts, Festivals, and the Jewish Calendar
objectives.objective_text: Interpret Jesus as the fulfillment of the Passover.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Feasts, Festivals, and the Jewish Calendar
objectives.objective_text: Connect the outpouring of the Spirit to the Feast of Weeks.
Compare a warrior king with a suffering servant.
Analyze the intertestamental literature (Enoch, Maccabees).
Interpret the 'Son of Man' title.
Connect Daniel's prophecies to 1st Century hopes.
Evaluate the challenges of biblical chronology (Masoretic vs. Septuagint numbers).
Recall that people wanted to know how to be happy.
Observe statues of philosophers.
Evaluate the 'chaos monster' motif (Leviathan/Rahab) in Scripture vs. ANE mythology.
Evaluate the 'lex talionis' (law of retaliation) as a limit on vengeance.
Evaluate the archaeological evidence for Israel's presence in Egypt.
Evaluate the cost and danger of travel despite the peace.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Roman Religion and the Imperial Cult
objectives.objective_text: Evaluate the mystery religions of the time.
Evaluate the radical nature of Christian fellowship.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Second Temple Judaism and Key Sects (Pharisees, Sadducees)
objectives.objective_text: Evaluate the expectation of a political Messiah.

objectives.sub_topic_name: The Synagogue System and the Sanhedrin
objectives.objective_text: Evaluate the legal authority of Jewish courts under Rome.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Feasts, Festivals, and the Jewish Calendar
objectives.objective_text: Evaluate the historical context of Hanukkah (Maccabees).
Evaluate why Judas might have betrayed Jesus (disappointment).
Construct a basic word study using a concordance.
Interpret the difference between a 'word-for-word' and 'thought-for-thought' translation.
Summarize Epicureans (seek pleasure) and Stoics (be tough).
Explain that they didn't know the true God.
Explain the pursuit of 'Ataraxia' (peace of mind).
Defend the resurrection against Greek skepticism.
Construct a synchronized timeline of Hebrew Kings and Assyrian/Babylonian rulers.
Construct a worldview comparison: Ancient Paganism vs. Biblical Theism vs. Modern Materialism.
Synthesize the impact of Aramaic as the 'lingua franca' of the ancient Near East.
Construct a comparison of ANE law codes and the Torah regarding the value of human life.
Synthesize the uniqueness of Israel's law being grounded in the character of Yahweh.
Construct a profile of the Assyrian war machine and its impact on Israel.
Synthesize the rise and fall of ANE empires with the prophecies of Daniel.
Construct a map of Paul's journeys utilizing Roman routes.
Synthesize the material conditions that facilitated the early church's growth.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Roman Religion and the Imperial Cult
objectives.objective_text: Construct a contrast between the Kingdom of Caesar and the Kingdom of Christ.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Roman Religion and the Imperial Cult
objectives.objective_text: Synthesize the cultural pressure to conform with the call to holiness.
Construct a profile of a typical Roman household.
Synthesize the sociology of the early church.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Second Temple Judaism and Key Sects (Pharisees, Sadducees)
objectives.objective_text: Construct a profile of First Century Judaism.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Second Temple Judaism and Key Sects (Pharisees, Sadducees)
objectives.objective_text: Synthesize the diversity within Judaism at the time of Christ.

objectives.sub_topic_name: The Synagogue System and the Sanhedrin
objectives.objective_text: Construct a diagram of the Sanhedrin's structure.

objectives.sub_topic_name: The Synagogue System and the Sanhedrin
objectives.objective_text: Synthesize the transition from Temple-based to Torah-based religion.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Feasts, Festivals, and the Jewish Calendar
objectives.objective_text: Construct a calendar of the Jewish Year.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Feasts, Festivals, and the Jewish Calendar
objectives.objective_text: Synthesize the cycle of remembrance in Jewish life.
Construct a profile of the different messianic expectations.
Synthesize the Jewish roots of Christian eschatology.
Evaluate how knowing original languages enriches theology (e.g., 'Chesed' - lovingkindness).
Compare wisdom of the world with wisdom of God.
Analyze Paul's speech in Acts 17.
Interpret the Stoic view of Logos vs. John's Logos.
Connect Gnosticism to Greek thought (spirit good, matter bad).
Evaluate the emptiness of philosophy without Christ.
Construct a comparison of Christian ethics with Stoic ethics.
Synthesize the interaction of the Gospel with the intellectual world.
